richardson.joshua.discount.code

Class UnidaysDiscountChallenge

  • java.lang.Object
    • richardson.joshua.discount.code.EasyInitialisation
      • richardson.joshua.discount.code.UnidaysDiscountChallenge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CalculateDiscounts

    public class UnidaysDiscountChallenge
extends EasyInitialisation
implements CalculateDiscounts
    UnidaysDiscountProgram takes a string of letters as an input and then calculates how much it would cost to purchase the items given the discounts that are to be applied. It takes into account the total price of the items in the basket and then works out the delivery price The total price is calculated

      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method in the program, it is used to call addToBasket() and calculateTotalPrice() to calculate the total price that the user will have to pay for their basket of items It uses some other methods too to initialise the program more efficiently and minimise repeated code

      • addToBasket

        public void addToBasket(char val)
        Description copied from interface: CalculateDiscounts
        Adds the items to the basket if they are eligible e.g. if user enters H it will ignore it as it is not a known item and will display a message The basket has been set up so that it is incremented for each of the values entered so there is no need to count the values at a later stage
        Specified by:
        addToBasket in interface CalculateDiscounts
        Parameters:
        val - is the letter of the item entered

      • calculateTotalPrice

        public double calculateTotalPrice()
        Description copied from interface: CalculateDiscounts
        Works out the total item price, delivery and total overall price
        Specified by:
        calculateTotalPrice in interface CalculateDiscounts
        Returns:
        double of the total price of the items + delivery cost
